reviewText: Maybe it was the heavy meal I had that night, but the sight of that scrawny turkey, Gobbles, with its broken neck, stupid look and ridiculous walk, made me wish throughout the episode, that his head would wind up sliced open, or crushed to death by the turkey truck, or shot to ashes by the South park hunters. I hate that retard Timmy. In the Thanksgiving episode, Stan (or Kyle) go to a turkey farm with the retard Timmy to pick a turkey for a Helen keller play the rest of the kids are trying to put on. Instead of picking a normal turkey, Timmy the moron picks the scrawniest stupidest bird in the cage, and despite Stan's pleas, he insists on buying it. The farmer charges them $50- for the hateful bird in spite of the fact that if he hadn't been bought, he would have taken it to the back and decapitated him anyway, probably throwing its useless carcass to the wolves. The rest of the episode is indeed funny, with Cartman and the rest of the cast complaining about the waste of money spent on that animal, and of it's inability to perfrom even the simplest tasks. Timmy patiently tries to teach the hapless animal to jump through a ring of fire. The animal now named Gibbles, (or Gobbles) pitifully tries to pick up speed and jump, but fails to even walk in a straight line because its malformed head always scrapes the ground. Instead, it craps on the carpet. Timmy is tricked into abandoning the Gibbles so that it will not be caught by the animal police. Gibbles is caught and taken to a turkey processing plant, thrown into a truck full of other turkeys, and dumped into a room in which a movie of mountains and woods is shown on the screen shortly before a rotating saw blade emerges from the side of the room and decapitates all of the birds except for Gibbles. The lucky bird falls off the truck carrying the carcasses and is about to be rightfully shot by one of the hunters when the moron Timmy appears out of nowhere and saves the animal from its proper extinction. The rest of the episode is very funny, with the final scene of Gibbles on Timmy's lap, probably pecking at Timmy's private parts. I repeat, The episode would have had a great ending if only Gibbles would have gotten maimed and bloodily killed, the way they always kill Kenny. I truly hated that animal, and Timmy the stupid retard.
summary: Kill Gibbles - I hate retards like Timmy!

reviewText: I'm sick and tired of these "theme packs". They're useless. I would never collect TV series if I could not get all episodes on chronological order, and I will not even if it's South Park. I have the two first seasons which are great on Region 1 (and were done by Rhino), but from now on I'm sticking with Region 2, on which all 4 seasons are available in chronological order. (I know this is the VHS version, I'm referring to the DVD releases)
summary: Warner should get their act together....

reviewText: All these episodes are on season 4, which is nice, it makes it easier to get rid of this from your collection and go buy Season 4. Do you really want to limit your South Park collection to only the episodes with the most annoying character on the show? Go buy Season 4!With that said...For anyone that doesn't know. Timmy is the retarded kid in a wheel chair that sits around saying "Timmy!" and sometimes saying something that sounds like "Livin' large."There is an episode where Timmy is the lead singer for a rock band and some loser guy is mad because he thinks everyone is making fun of Timmy. Also, the kids all get on ridilin in this episode.There is an episode where the kids go into the fourth grade and try to teleport back to third grade and these nerds attach it to Timmy's wheel chair and everyone thinks its a bomb, but it sends Timmy back in time.There is an episode where the kids have to put on a thanksgiving play and they hire a fancy turkey to do a stunt but Timmy wants to use his retarded chicken.Finally there is the best episodes (the episode with barely any Timmy.) People ask why this episode is on the Timmy DVD, well if they read the thing about it on the back, its the first episode with Timmy in it. In this one Cartman pretends to be the tooth fairy and gets Stan, Kyle, and Kenny to help him steal people's teeth for money.Here are my parting words of wisdom on this disc:Timmy is annoying, but the plots for all the episodes are funny.
summary: All these episodes are on Season 4
Title: N/A

reviewText: While I must admit that I wish they would release the South Park episodes in order - this dvd still has a lot to offer any fan of the series. Included in the four episodes are "Timmy 2000", "4th Grade", "Helen Keller, The Musical" and "The Tooth Fairy's Tats 2000".In "Timmy 2000" we get are first look at Timmy and the kids enjoy the benefits of ridilin.  This episode is hilarious (and makes a very real point) with the over use of ridilin for every child that acts out.  The funniest bit in the entire episode is the Christina Aguliera monster that tries to eat Cartman."4th Grade" is another great episode - there's so much that goes on.  The gang enter 4th grade with their new teacher, Timmy goes back in time (with a great spoof of "Speed") and Mr. Garrison finally comes out (with another great spoof of "Star Wars").The episode "Helen Keller, The Musical" has to be one of the funniest episodes ever.  In competing for the Thanksgiving play, Timmy finds a friend with Gobbles (the physically challenged turkey).  I don't want to say much more other than this is one of the best episodes they've ever done.The bonus episode "The Tooth Fairy's Tats 2000" is the weakest episode on the disk.  It's good, just not up to the rest.  Since Timmy is barely on it, I don't know why they chose it to put on this disk.Overall the disk is great and well worth the price.  I hate that they aren't releasing the episodes in order - that's Warner Brothers for you - but until they do, I'll be happy with what they have released.
summary: Great Addition to the South Park collection
